							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
815 PM PDT SUN APR 15 2007

CAZ040-041-161000-
/O.CON.KLOX.CF.S.0005.000000T0000Z-070416T1700Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
815 PM PDT SUN APR 15 2007

..HIGHER THAN NORMAL SURF OVER LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY
BEACHES...

STRONG AND WIDESPREAD WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO IMPACT
THE COASTAL WATERS OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA...WHICH WILL GENERATE A
MODERATE TO LARGE SHORT PERIOD WIND SWELL. THIS WIND SWELL WILL
BUILD THROUGH THIS EVENING...THEN SLOWLY SUBSIDE THROUGH MONDAY
MORNING. AS A RESULT...SHORT PERIOD CHOPPY SURF BETWEEN 4 TO 6 FT
WILL CONTINUE ALONG THE WINDIEST AND MOST EXPOSED WEST FACING
BEACHES OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTY THROUGH EARLY MONDAY
MORNING. LOCAL SETS TO 8 FEET WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH THE EVENING
HOURS.

STRONG RIP CURRENTS WILL ALSO IMPACT THE AREA THROUGH MONDAY...
WHICH WILL MAKE SWIMMING OR SURFING IN THESE HIGHER THAN NORMAL
WAVES VERY DANGEROUS FOR ANYONE. IF IN DOUBT...JUST STAY OUT.

$$

GOMBERG/KITTELL
